jproductioncritic

Class ErrorReport

  • java.lang.Object
    • jproductioncritic.ErrorReport

  • public class ErrorReport
extends java.lang.Object
    An object of this class stores the information associated with a particular error detected in an audio file. The fields of objects of this class store the basic information associated with the error. Methods are also included for merging error reports of the same type that are close in time and for formatting error reports for output in various ways.
    Author:
    Cory McKay

    • Field Detail

      • error_identifier

        public java.lang.String error_identifier
        The name of the error type. May not be null.

      • is_instantaneous

        public boolean is_instantaneous
        Whether the error is instantaneous (only exists at a single time) or spans a range of times. Is true in the former case and false in the latter case.

      • start_time

        public int start_time
        The time in milliseconds at which the error exists (in the case of instantaneous errors) or the point in time at which the error begins (in the case of errors spanning a range of time). May not be less than zero.

      • end_time

        public int end_time
        The time in milliseconds at which the error ends (in the case of errors spanning a range of time), or -1 in the case of instantaneous errors. Should otherwise be larger than start_time.

      • severity

        public java.lang.String severity
        An indication of the severity of the error. Is typically either "Mild", "Moderate" or "Severe". May be null if no severity indication is available.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ErrorReport

        public ErrorReport(java.lang.String error_identifier,
                   boolean is_instantaneous,
                   int start_time,
                   int end_time,
                   java.lang.String severity)
        Create an error report consisting of the specified information.
        Parameters:
        error_identifier - The name of the error type. May not be null.
        is_instantaneous - Whether the error is instantaneous (only exists at a single time) or spans a range of times. Is true in the former case and false in the latter case.
        start_time - The time in milliseconds at which the error exists (in the case of instantaneous errors) or the point in time at which the error begins (in the case of errors spanning a range of time). May not be less than zero.
        end_time - The time in milliseconds at which the error ends (in the case of errors spanning a range of time), or -1 in the case of instantaneous errors.
        severity - An indication of the severity of the error. Is typically either "Mild", "Moderate" or "Severe". May be null if no severity indication is available.

    • Method Detail

      • getTextToAddToTextReport

        public java.lang.String getTextToAddToTextReport()
        Returns the information stored in this error report as a string with one line for each field of the object, followed by a single blank line.
        Returns:
        The information stored in this object.

      • getTextToAddToHtmlReport

        public java.lang.String getTextToAddToHtmlReport()
        Returns the information stored in this error report as a string with one line for each field of the object, followed by a single blank line. All of this is HTML-formatted.
        Returns:
        The information stored in this object.

      • getTextToAddToAudacityLabelTrack

        public java.lang.String getTextToAddToAudacityLabelTrack()
        Returns the information stored in this error report as a string that represents one line of an Audacity label track file. This consists of the start time of the error (in seconds), followed by a tab, followed by the end time of the error (in seconds), followed by a tab, followed by a label indicating the error type and its severity.
        Returns:
        The information stored in this object.

      • getContentToAddToAceXmlFile

        public ace.datatypes.SegmentedClassification getContentToAddToAceXmlFile()
        Returns the information stored in this error report as an ACE SegmentedClassification object corresponding to a single SegmentedClassification sub-classification. No top level SegmentedClassification is generated here. Start and end stamps are specified (in seconds), and two class labels are assigned: first the identifier for this error, and then its severity.
        Returns:
        The information stored in this object.

      • getTextToAddToWekaArffFile

        public java.lang.String getTextToAddToWekaArffFile()
        Returns the information stored in this error report as a string consisting of a single line corresponding to a single Weka ARFF instance. The comma-delimited attributes consist of start time (in seconds), end time (in seconds), severity and (as the class attribute) the error identifier (with whitespace removed).
        Returns:
        The information stored in this object.

      • mergeErrorReports

        public static java.util.ArrayList<ErrorReport> mergeErrorReports(java.util.ArrayList<ErrorReport> to_merge,
                                                                 int proximity_threshold)
        Takes in a ArrayList of ErrorReport objects of the same type and merges those non-instantaneous reports that overlap with one another (in terms of the interval between the start_time and the end_time) as well as any pairs of reports that are within proximity_threshold milliseconds of one another. A new ArrayList is returned consisting of the results (even if no merges needed to be performed).
        Parameters:
        to_merge - The ArrayList of ErrorReport objects to merge if appropriate. It is assumed that the objects all have identical error_identifier fields, and that each ErrorReport object is listed sequentially from first to last based on its start_time field. The ArrayList may not be null, but it may be empty.
        proximity_threshold - The maximum amount of time in milliseconds separating ErrorReport objects that should be merged. No merging will occur if this value is negative (except in the case of merging overlapping non-instantaneous reports, which will always be merged).
        Returns:
        A new ArrayList of new ErrorReport objects identical in content to that provided except that some ErrorReport objects may have been merged.
